intro: Hieracium tephropogon, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems, which are typical features of many hawkweed species. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in a variety of habitats, including meadows and disturbed soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hieracium tephropogon is often found in clusters, with its basal leaves forming a rosette structure.
